laboratory_examinations.findings: Complete lesion of the common peroneal nerve, with loss of conduction and fibrillation potentials in sampled muscles.
Demonstrated nascent and polyphasic units against a background of fibrillation, suggesting early reinnervation of muscle units within both divisions of the common peroneal nerve.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At fifteen months following the nerve repair, the patient demonstrated normal strength in the hamstrings against 'full' resistance.
